xxl.core.relational.metaData
Interface ColumnMetaData

All Known Implementing Classes:
DecoratorColumnMetaData, RenamedColumnMetaData, ResultSetMetaDataColumnMetaData, StoredColumnMetaData
public interface ColumnMetaData

This class provides relational metadata for a column in a result set.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getCatalogName()
          Gets this column's table's catalog name.
 java.lang.String getColumnClassName()
          Returns the fully-qualified name of the Java class whose instances are manufactured if the method ResultSet.getObject is called to retrieve a value from the column described by this metadata.
 int getColumnDisplaySize()
          Indicates this column's normal maximum width in characters.
 java.lang.String getColumnLabel()
          Gets this column's suggested title for use in printouts and displays.
 java.lang.String getColumnName()
          Get this column's name.
 int getColumnType()
          Retrieves this column's SQL type.
 java.lang.String getColumnTypeName()
          Retrieves this column's database-specific type name.
 int getPrecision()
          Get this column's number of decimal digits.
 int getScale()
          Gets this column's number of digits to right of the decimal point.
 java.lang.String getSchemaName()
          Get this column's table's schema.
 java.lang.String getTableName()
          Gets this column's table name.
 boolean isAutoIncrement()
          Indicates whether this column is automatically numbered, thus read-only.
 boolean isCaseSensitive()
          Indicates whether this column's case matters.
 boolean isCurrency()
          Indicates whether this column is a cash value.
 boolean isDefinitelyWritable()
          Indicates whether a write on this column will definitely succeed.
 int isNullable()
          Indicates the nullability of values in this column.
 boolean isReadOnly()
          Indicates whether this column is definitely not writable.
 boolean isSearchable()
          Indicates whether this column can be used in a where clause.
 boolean isSigned()
          Indicates whether values in this column are signed numbers.
 boolean isWritable()
          Indicates whether it is possible for a write on this column to succeed.
 

Method Detail

isAutoIncrement

boolean isAutoIncrement()
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates whether this column is automatically numbered, thus read-only.

Returns:
true if so; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

isNullable

int isNullable()
               throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates the nullability of values in this column.

Returns:
the nullability status of the given column; one of ResultSetMetaData.columnNoNulls, ResultSetMetaData.columnNullable or ResultSetMetaData.columnNullableUnknown.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates this column's normal maximum width in characters.

Returns:
the normal maximum number of characters allowed as the width of the designated column.

java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getCatalogName

java.lang.String getCatalogName()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
Gets this column's table's catalog name.

Returns:
the name of the catalog for the table in which the given column appears or "" if not applicable.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnType

int getColumnType()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves this column's SQL type.

Returns:
SQL type from java.sql.Types.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
See Also:
Types

getColumnTypeName

java.lang.String getColumnTypeName()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves this column's database-specific type name.

Returns:
type name used by the database. If the column type is a user-defined type, then a fully-qualified type name is returned.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

isReadOnly

boolean isReadOnly()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates whether this column is definitely not writable.

Returns:
true if so; false otherwise.

java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

isWritable

boolean isWritable()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates whether it is possible for a write on this column to succeed.

Returns:
true if so; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

isDefinitelyWritable

boolean isDefinitelyWritable()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
Indicates whether a write on this column will definitely succeed.

Returns:
true if so; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnClassName

java.lang.String getColumnClassName()
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the fully-qualified name of the Java class whose instances are manufactured if the method ResultSet.getObject is called to retrieve a value from the column described by this metadata. ResultSet.getObject may return a subclass of the class returned by this method.

Returns:
the fully-qualified name of the class in the Java programming language that would be used by the method ResultSet.getObject to retrieve the value in the specified column. This is the class name used for custom mapping.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
